text: Wynns Coonawarra Estate is an Australian winery located in Coonawarra, South Australia within the Coonawarra wine region. ==History== The estate was founded in 1891 by John Riddoch. He recognised the potential of the now famous red soil and planted vines. In 1951, the vineyard was bought by David and Samuel Wynn, who renamed it from Chateau Comaum. It is now the region's largest vineyard owned by Treasury Wine Estates. Grapevines at Wynns in Coonawarra ==References== Category:Wineries in South Australia Category:Foster's Group Category:Treasury Wine Estates Category:Limestone Coast
title: Wynns (wine)
